summary: This bill, the "Ending Medicaid Discrimination Against the Most Vulnerable Act," aims to phase out the enhanced Federal medical assistance percentage (FMAP) for low-income adults under Medicaid. It modifies the Social Security Act to gradually reduce the enhanced federal match, with specific rules for states that have or have not expanded Medicaid coverage. The bill also includes provisions regarding how the FMAP applies to states that expand their Medicaid eligibility.
